page.title: 14 The New A45 Bypass
page.content: The A45 Bypass opened in November 1980 was intended to take heavy traffic away from the village of Earls Barton,Great Doddington and Wilby. The villagers of Earls Barton are thankful and relieved that the new road skirting the housing estates of the village has taken traffic away from the village centre through which it is now quieter and safer to walk. However the link road is very busy and noisy particularly from large container lorries early in the morning. In Doddington the farmers are concerned that they have lost good agricultural land even though those who lost land were compensated. All the villagers are happy now that the village road is quieter.
